10 hours ago, pandaman said:

Well, it is a Pre-Release version intended for player testing to find and filter out more bugs, before ACTUAL release, so it should be expected really.  The trick, and the intention behind the pre-release, is for players to report them as well as they can to help the devs fix them before ACTUAL full release.

which is why i said I'll wait... let you ....nice people... I mean... mugs... find them for me... errr... sorry.

7 hours ago, Terwin said:

Sounds like you are good at finding bugs.

If you want a bug-free 1.2 release, you should really load up the early release build and report all the bugs(with reproduction steps) in the pre-release bug tracker.

That way you can help get those bugs fixed for everyone.

Read my last few posts....

Porkjet's new MK1 pod is great, but the bottom is so rounded and elongated that it extends through and past the 1.5M heat shield...Not sure the heat shield will provide any protection.

I'd like to share my experience with the 1.2.-1 version of KSP.

Downloaded the Mac version from the Store. Then I walked away while it pulled it in. When I returned, I launched the Launcher to get the video settings right. Then I launched the game itself.

I was immediately impressed both by the aspect of the loading scene and by the alacrity with which the loading bar sped across the screen. I'm a mod-heavy guy, though, so I'm not sure how that actually compares to 1.1.

As the title screen floated before me, I checked all my settings. Once they seemed in order, I loaded up a new Sandbox save and entered the SPH.

And stopped dead.

The framerate was pegged at a rock-solid 25FPS. Buttons took their sweet time to register mouseover. An orange truck made its way chunkily across my screen. It was painful. I sat in my seat, baffled.

Orange truck?

Suddenly I realized I'd missed a setting. After firing the Space Center Crew, I returned to the SPH to find buttery smoothness. I flew the Aeris 3A a couple times, crashed it because the sim speed is too fast since the update (or so I tell myself). I took my mining rig, the Scarab, out for a spin--no popped tires! Which was particularly suprising for this craft, since it basically lived on its landing gear because of the fragile tires. Energized, I built a little one-Jeb buggy, which drove admirably, and took jumps like a beast. And then I went to make a crazy flexible chassis testbed.

And sighed heavily.

The wheels' Autostrut parameter included the word "Locked." This saddened me, since my hour and a half was nearly up, and I didn't have time to make .cfg edits. So, I put it off until tomorrow.
in scott manleys video about 1.2 he showed off being able to set the priority of how the fuel drains, i can not seem to figure out how to do that. is that feature not in for 1.2 anymore?

The FPS improvement is really impressive on my side. Well done !

Also the KerbNet system seems really great. I especially liked the "complete loss of control for probes" option in the difficulty settings.

With even more polishing, that v1.2 is going to be a great one !

5 hours ago, blejzu said:

I'm playing on Mac and I've noticed huge performance degradation. AVB is almost unusable. But once the rocket is launched performance is quite normal. Can someone else confirm the same problem?

Check the debug window debug output (or output_log.txt) - if it's spewing hundreds of errors per second, it'll lag like crazy.

Edited September 14, 2016 by Waz

5 hours ago, blejzu said:

I'm playing on Mac and I've noticed huge performance degradation. AVB is almost unusable. But once the rocket is launched performance is quite normal. Can someone else confirm the same problem?

Try turning off the Space Center Crew. Fixed it for me.

21 minutes ago, tyler45455 said:

in scott manleys video about 1.2 he showed off being able to set the priority of how the fuel drains, i can not seem to figure out how to do that. is that feature not in for 1.2 anymore?

No it's there. I set a particularly pesky rocket up to drain fuel backwards and it worked like a charm.

It may be an "Advanced Tweakables" option. You can set that in Settings (outside of a game, off the first menu when you start) I think, or somewhere in the Alt-F12 menu.
i do have advanced tweakables enabled but when i right click on the fuel tanks it doesnt give me the option it just lets me change the amount of fuel and mono propelent

@tyler45455 welcome to the forums!

However, if that flow priority item is not showing up for a tank, then no, you do not have advanced tweakables enabled. Go back to Space Center view, hit Esc, go to Settings, and toggle Advanced Tweakables to on. Then go back to the VAB.

Those parts are unfinished, no wonder you got issues.

Had the same during an aggressive mun reentry and the shield proved useless, had to use cheats to survive.

Edited September 15, 2016 by Temeter

8 hours ago, genbrien said:

anyone noticed new landging legs deployment sounds?

 

They sound like a cartoon power drill.  They don't really match the animations either.  I'm not sure I like them tp be honest.

Overall, 1.2 seems pretty good. KSPedia needs updating, hopefully that goes in before its released. Porkjet's parts look fab, I hope they get in soon and that 0.625 and 2.5m get the same treatment.  I really like the new high gain antenna.

Why has KSPUtil.dll been removed? And will it be added back or is there a alternative to it? It is important for my mod Syncrio to work.

Edit: Never mind I got it.

Edited September 15, 2016 by Caylis1397

I have a bug: In create-a-kerbal, I made one and now the page is locked up meaning I can no longer create another kerbal.

Not game breaking, but a let down. I wanted to launch the entire mercury 7 on one shuttle flight

Really loving this version @SQUAD one nice new bit of polish is Kerbals on EVA, they feel really solid on ladders and when jumping around onto things.

I haven't seen any of the new loading screens because it loads so frickin' fast now.

Edited September 15, 2016 by Waxing_Kibbous

Perform orbital survey is missing in the action menu.

Hello. I put some satellites in polar orbit arround Kerbin, in the recommended alttitude. When I click on the m700 it deployed the antena, but the option of perform orbital survey is missing. Instead, I got the option window as if the orbital survey were performed (cut+,  cut-, overlay, resource...), but it didn't. Resources where not overlayed in the vessel screen nor in the map screen.

I had no mods, I also delete the whole game and re-downloaded from Steam. But the issue persisted.

I run all test in sandbox mode. Interestingly, in the scenario of exploring Eeloo, the perform orbital survey was available, but I didn't see the Comm network indicator.

Great upgrade, anyhow. Congrats to all Squad staff.
I had a question, who knows the password of the steam Beta?
